data.title: Directions & Transportation
data.text:
Getting to Isle Royale in Three Easy Steps

2. Catch Your Island Transportation

Will you travel by ferry, seaplane, or private boat?

Travel from Houghton, Copper Harbor, Grand Portage, or Grand Marais.

3. Where Will You Arrive on the Island?

East End: Rock Harbor

West End: Windigo

Departing From Michigan

Departing from Houghton, Michigan Aboard the Ranger III or Isle Royale Seaplanes

Step 1: Travel to Houghton, Michigan

Vehicle: Houghton is located in Michigan's Upper Peninsula. It is 200 miles north of Green Bay, Wisconsin, 400 miles north of Chicago, Illinois, and 250 miles west of the Mackinac Bridge. Houghton is located off US-41 at the base of the Keweenaw Peninsula.

Airplane: United Airlines provides daily flights to the Houghton County Memorial Airport, located eight miles north of Houghton on US-41.

Bus: Indian Trails offers daily service to Houghton, Michigan.

Step 2: Travel to Houghton Transportation Departure Location

Ferry: Ranger III serviced at the Park’s Mainland Headquarters located at 800 E. Lakeshore Dr., Houghton, Michigan.

Seaplane: Isle Royale Seaplanes is located on Torch Lake, 26998 W 16th, Hubbell, MI 49934

Step 3: Arrive at Isle Royale National Park

Arrive at Rock Harbor via Ranger III or seaplane.

Ranger III travel time: 6 hours

Outbound Departure at 9:00 am eastern time/8:00 am central time

Arrive to Rock Harbor at 3:00 pm eastern time/2:00 pm central time

Seaplane travel time: about 40 minutes

Continue to Windigo via Voyageur II or seaplane from Rock Harbor.

Departing from Copper Harbor, Michigan Aboard Isle Royale Queen IV

Step 1: Travel to Copper Harbor, Michigan

Vehicle: Copper Harbor is located at the tip of Michigan's Keweenaw Peninsula, in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan. It is located off US-41 just 52 miles north of Houghton, Michigan.

Airplane: United Airlines provides daily flights to the Houghton County Memorial Airport, located 44 miles south of Copper Harbor on US-41.

Bus: Unavailable

Step 2: Travel to Copper Harbor Transportation Departure Location

Ferry: Isle Royale Queen IV serviced by the Isle Royale Line located at 14 Waterfront Landing, Copper Harbor, Michigan 49918.

Seaplane: Unavailable

Step 3: Arrive at Isle Royale National Park

Arrive at Rock Harbor via Isle Royale Queen IV.

Travel Time: 3.5 hours

Outbound Departure at 8:00 am eastern time

Arrive to Rock Harbor at 11:30 am eastern time

Continue to Windigo via Voyageur II or seaplane from Rock Harbor.

Departing From Minnesota

Departing from Grand Portage, Minnesota Aboard the Voyageur II or Sea Hunter III

Step 1: Travel to Grand Portage, Minnesota

Vehicle: Grand Portage, located in Minnesota's northeastern section, is 150 miles north of Duluth, Minnesota. It is located off US-61 50 miles southwest of Thunder Bay, Ontario, Canada.

Airplane: The closest airport, Thunder Bay International, is 50 miles northeast of Grand Portage. The Duluth International Airport is located 150 miles south of Grand Portage.

Bus: Arrowhead Transit offers service between Duluth and Grand Marais with stops along the North Shore of Minnesota on Tuesdays. Shuttles then run between Grand Marais and Grand Portage every weekday.

Step 2: Travel to Grand Portage Transportation Departure Location

Ferry: Voyageur II and Sea Hunter III are serviced from the Grand Portage Marina located at 402 Upper Rd, Grand Portage, Minnesota 55605.

Seaplane: Not available.

Step 3: Arrive at Isle Royale National Park

Arrive at Windigo via Voyageur II or Sea Hunter III.

Voyageur II travel time: 2 hours.

Outbound Departure at 8:30 am eastern time/ 7:30 am central time

Arrive to Windigo at 10:30 am eastern time/9:30 am central time

Sea Hunter III travel time: 1.5 hours.

Outbound Departure at 9:30 am eastern time/8:30 am central time

Arrive to Windigo at 11:00 am eastern time/10:00 am central time

Continue to Rock Harbor via Voyageur II or seaplane from Windigo.

Voyageur II travel time: 5 hours.

Arrive to Rock Harbor at 4:00 pm eastern time/3:00 pm central time aboard Voyageur II.

Departing from Grand Marais, Minnesota with Isle Royale Seaplanes

Step 1: Travel to Grand Marais, Minnesota

Vehicle: Grand Marais, located in Minnesota’s northeastern section, is 110 miles north of Duluth, Minnesota. It is located off US-61 80 miles southwest of Thunder Bay, Ontario, Canada.

Airplane: The closest airport, Thunder Bay International, is 80 miles northeast of Grand Marais. The Duluth International Airport is located 110 miles south of Grand Marais.

Step 2: Travel to Grand Marais Transportation Departure Location

Step 3: Arrive at Isle Royale National Park

Arrive at Rock Harbor via seaplane.

Travel time: about 45 minutes.

Arrive at Windigo via seaplane.

Travel time: about 30 minutes.

Transportation Options

Houghton, MI

RANGER III

The RANGER III passenger ferry operates between Houghton, MI and Rock Harbor, MI.

Copper Harbor, MI

QUEEN IV

The ISLE ROYALE QUEEN IV passenger ferry operates between Copper Harbor, MI and Rock Harbor, MI.

Grand Portage, MN

SEA HUNTER III

The SEA HUNTER III passenger ferry operates between Grand Portage, MN to Windigo, MI.

Grand Portage, MN

VOYAGEUR II

The VOYAGEUR II passenger ferry operates from Grand Portage, MN, to Windigo and Rock Harbor, MI.

Hancock, MI & Grand Marais, MN

Isle Royale Seaplanes

Isle Royale Seaplanes provide daily flights between Hancock, MI and Grand Marais, MN to Windigo and Rock Harbor, MI.

Boaters

Boating at Isle Royale

Explore Isle Royale with your private boat.

RANGER III Availability

Ranger III Reservation Availability
